Al Riqqa, or Al Rigga is a locality in
, one of the seven emirates of The United Arab Emirates.

Is the fifth in the line of these luxury supermarkets. Being some of the largest in the world. A 10,000sq foot supermarket will offer the same services and selection as Aswaaq's additional four supermarket facilities located in Nad Al Hamar, Mizhar, Umm Sequim and Al Sufouh. The bakery, in-house butcher, fishery, and fresh fruit and vegetable sections will offer a variety of international products catering to populations from across the globe. Home delivery services will also be available, and shoppers can take advantage of WAFA loyalty points as well as other promotions.Speaking of the opening, Mr. Abdul Baset Al Janahi the CEO of Aswaaq said:

"The opening of this branch marks a significant step in Aswaaq's UAE expansion plan. For one, the location in Al Rigga means we can reach a booming sector of the city. Also, the Aswaaq 'street market' design will fit comfortably into the surrounding environment, further enhancing Al Rigga's reputation as a pedestrian-friendly city centre."

Expectations for the supermarket are high as a new metro station in Al Rigga facilitates the movement of people to the supermarket from across the city. Located in the popular Deira side of Dubai, Al Rigga Street is considered one of the most thrilling parts of the city as dozens of restaurants and shops line pedestrian walkways on both sides of the road.
